's most well-known lines I' 2. 's quiz here' Detailed analysis saved to: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/anagram_question_analysis.json Summary report saved to: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/anagram_question_summary.txt Temporary file cleaned up: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/temp_anagram_audio.wav *** ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ***
tester Code Testing
2025-08-10 23:44:42

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and successfully transcribed the professor's audio file. The speech recognition extracted the key content: 'is actually an anagram of one of The Bard's most well-known lines I'd like you all to think about it and anyone who can provide the original line will get an automatic a on next week's quiz here's the anagram in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten'. However, the regex pattern analysis didn't capture the actual anagram phrase correctly - the quoted phrases found ('s most well-known lines I' and 's quiz here') are fragments, not the complete anagram. **PLAN** alignment: 75% - successfully transcribed audio and identified it's about finding Shakespeare's original line, but missed extracting the actual anagram phrase 'in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten'. Next step: The anagram to solve is clearly stated in the transcription - it's the long phrase at the end that needs to be rearranged to find the original Shakespeare line from Hamlet.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">from mutagen "keyword">import File "keyword">import speech_recognition "keyword">as sr "keyword">from pydub "keyword">import AudioSegment "keyword">import json # The path to the audio file to be parsed audio_path = "data/gaia/2023/validation/2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65.mp3" print("=== AUDIO FILE ANALYSIS FOR PROFESSOR&#x27;S ANAGRAM QUESTION ===") print(f"Analyzing file: {audio_path}") # Check "keyword">if file exists "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(audio_path): print(f"Error: Audio file &#x27;{audio_path}' does "keyword">not exist.") # List available files "keyword">in the validation directory validation_dir = "data/gaia/2023/validation/" "keyword">if os.path.exists(validation_dir): print(f"Available files "keyword">in {validation_dir}:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(validation_dir): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.mp3', '.wav', '.m4a', '.aac')): print(f" - {file}") "keyword">else: print(f"File exists: {audio_path}") file_size = os.path.getsize(audio_path) print(f"File size: {file_size} bytes ({file_size / (1024 * 1024):.2f} MB)") supported_formats = [&#x27;.mp3', '.wav', '.m4a', '.aac', '.flac', '.ogg', '.wma'] file_ext = os.path.splitext(audio_path)[1].lower() print(f"File extension: {file_ext}") "keyword">if file_ext "keyword">not "keyword">in supported_formats: print(f"Error: Unsupported audio format &#x27;{file_ext}'. Supported formats: {', '.join(supported_formats)}") "keyword">else: print(f"Audio format "keyword">is supported: {file_ext}") # Extract metadata using mutagen print("\n=== EXTRACTING AUDIO METADATA ===") audiofile = File(audio_path) "keyword">if audiofile "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None: "keyword">if hasattr(audiofile, &#x27;mime') "keyword">and audiofile.mime: print(f"Format: {audiofile.mime[0]}") "keyword">if hasattr(audiofile.info, &#x27;length'): duration = audiofile.info.length print(f"Duration: {duration:.2f} seconds ({duration/60:.1f} minutes)") "keyword">if hasattr(audiofile.info, &#x27;bitrate'): print(f"Bitrate: {audiofile.info.bitrate} bps") # Extract common tags like title, artist, album, date, genre tags = [&#x27;title', 'artist', 'album', 'date', 'genre'] "keyword">for tag "keyword">in tags: "keyword">if tag "keyword">in audiofile "keyword">and audiofile[tag]: print(f"{tag.capitalize()}: {audiofile[tag][0]}") "keyword">else: print("Could "keyword">not extract metadata "keyword">from audio file") # Extract transcription using speech recognition print("\n=== CONVERTING AUDIO TO TEXT USING SPEECH RECOGNITION ===") print("Loading audio file "keyword">with pydub...") "keyword">try: # Load the audio file audio = AudioSegment.from_file(audio_path) print(f"Audio loaded successfully: {len(audio)} ms duration") # Create temporary WAV file "keyword">for speech recognition temp_wav = "workspace/temp_anagram_audio.wav" print(f"Converting to WAV format "keyword">for speech recognition: {temp_wav}") # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs("workspace", exist_ok="keyword">True) # Export "keyword">as WAV "keyword">with optimal settings "keyword">for speech recognition audio.export(temp_wav, format="wav", parameters=["-ar", "16000", "-ac", "1"]) print(f"Audio converted to WAV: {os.path.getsize(temp_wav)} bytes") # Initialize speech recognizer recognizer = sr.Recognizer() print("Speech recognizer initialized") # Process the audio "keyword">for transcription print("Loading audio into speech recognizer...") "keyword">with sr.AudioFile(temp_wav) "keyword">as source: print("Adjusting "keyword">for ambient noise...") recognizer.adjust_for_ambient_noise(source, duration=0.5) print("Recording audio data...") audio_data = recognizer.record(source) print(f"Audio data recorded successfully") print("\n=== TRANSCRIBING AUDIO TO TEXT ===") print("Attempting transcription "keyword">with Google Speech Recognition...") # Transcribe audio to text using Google Speech Recognition "keyword">try: text = recognizer.recognize_google(audio_data, language=&#x27;en-US') print(f"\n*** TRANSCRIPTION SUCCESSFUL ***") print(f"Transcribed text length: {len(text)} characters") print("\n=== PROFESSOR&#x27;S ANAGRAM QUESTION CONTENT ===") print(text) # Save the transcription to workspace "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/professor_anagram_transcription.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write("PROFESSOR&#x27;S ANAGRAM QUESTION TRANSCRIPTION\n") f.write("=" * 50 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Source: {os.path.basename(audio_path)}\n") f.write(f"Transcribed on: {__import__(&#x27;datetime').datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n\n") f.write("TRANSCRIBED CONTENT:\n") f.write("-" * 30 + "\n") f.write(text) f.write("\n" + "-" * 30) print(f"\nTranscription saved to: workspace/professor_anagram_transcription.txt") # Now analyze the text "keyword">for anagram-related content print("\n=== ANALYZING TEXT FOR ANAGRAM QUESTION ===") print("Searching "keyword">for anagram instructions "keyword">and original phrase...") "keyword">import re # Look "keyword">for key anagram-related phrases anagram_keywords = [ &#x27;anagram', 'rearrange', 'letters', 'scramble', 'unscramble', &#x27;reorder', 'permutation', 'mix up', 'jumble', 'word puzzle' ] text_lower = text.lower() found_keywords = [] "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in anagram_keywords: "keyword">if keyword "keyword">in text_lower: found_keywords.append(keyword) # Find context around the keyword start_pos = text_lower.find(keyword) context_start = max(0, start_pos - 50) context_end = min(len(text), start_pos + len(keyword) + 50) context = text[context_start:context_end] print(f"Found &#x27;{keyword}' "keyword">in context: ...{context}...") print(f"\nAnagram-related keywords found: {found_keywords}") # Look "keyword">for quoted phrases "keyword">or specific instructions print("\n=== SEARCHING FOR QUOTED PHRASES OR SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS ===") # Look "keyword">for quoted text (potential original phrase to anagram) - FIXED REGEX PATTERNS quote_patterns = [ r&#x27;"([^"]+)"', # Double quotes r"&#x27;([^']+)'", # Single quotes r&#x27;phrase\s+["\']([^"\' ]+)["\']', # "phrase 'text'" r&#x27;line\s+["\']([^"\' ]+)["\']', # "line 'text'" r&#x27;words?\s+["\']([^"\' ]+)["\']', # "word 'text'" ] quoted_phrases = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in quote_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: phrase = match.group(1) # Get context start_context = max(0, match.start() - 40) end_context = min(len(text), match.end() + 40) context = text[start_context:end_context] quoted_phrases.append({ &#x27;phrase': phrase, &#x27;context': context, &#x27;pattern': pattern }) print(f"Found quoted phrase: &#x27;{phrase}'") print(f" Context: ...{context}...") # Look "keyword">for instruction patterns print("\n=== SEARCHING FOR INSTRUCTION PATTERNS ===") instruction_patterns = [ r&#x27;make an anagram of (.+?)(?:\.|$)', r&#x27;create an anagram "keyword">from (.+?)(?:\.|$)', r&#x27;rearrange the letters? of (.+?)(?:\.|$)', r&#x27;scramble the word[s]? (.+?)(?:\.|$)', r&#x27;form an anagram using (.+?)(?:\.|$)', r&#x27;anagram the phrase (.+?)(?:\.|$)', r&#x27;take the (?:phrase|line|words?) (.+?) "keyword">and', r&#x27;using the letters? (?:"keyword">from|"keyword">in|of) (.+?)(?:,|\.|$)' ] instructions = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in instruction_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: instruction_text = match.group(1).strip() # Clean up common endings instruction_text = re.sub(r&#x27;[,\.]$', '', instruction_text) # Get context start_context = max(0, match.start() - 30) end_context = min(len(text), match.end() + 30) context = text[start_context:end_context] instructions.append({ &#x27;original_phrase': instruction_text, &#x27;context': context, &#x27;pattern': pattern }) print(f"Found instruction: &#x27;{instruction_text}'") print(f" Context: ...{context}...") # Compile results results = { &#x27;source_file': os.path.basename(audio_path), &#x27;transcription': text, &#x27;anagram_keywords_found': found_keywords, &#x27;quoted_phrases': quoted_phrases, &#x27;instructions': instructions, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': __import__('datetime').datetime.now().isoformat() } # Save detailed analysis "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/anagram_question_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===") print(f"Anagram keywords found: {len(found_keywords)}") print(f"Quoted phrases found: {len(quoted_phrases)}") print(f"Instruction patterns found: {len(instructions)}") "keyword">if quoted_phrases: print(f"\nMost likely original phrase(s) to anagram:") "keyword">for i, phrase_info "keyword">in enumerate(quoted_phrases, 1): print(f" {i}. &#x27;{phrase_info['phrase']}'") "keyword">if instructions: print(f"\nInstruction-based phrases to anagram:") "keyword">for i, inst "keyword">in enumerate(instructions, 1): print(f" {i}. &#x27;{inst['original_phrase']}'") # Create summary report "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/anagram_question_summary.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write("PROFESSOR&#x27;S ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS SUMMARY\n") f.write("=" * 55 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Source Audio: {os.path.basename(audio_path)}\n\n") f.write("FULL TRANSCRIPTION:\n") f.write("-" * 20 + "\n") f.write(text + "\n") f.write("-" * 20 + "\n\n") "keyword">if found_keywords: f.write(f"ANAGRAM KEYWORDS DETECTED: {&#x27;, '.join(found_keywords)}\n\n") "keyword">if quoted_phrases: f.write("QUOTED PHRASES (Potential Original Text):\n") "keyword">for i, phrase_info "keyword">in enumerate(quoted_phrases, 1): f.write(f" {i}. &#x27;{phrase_info['phrase']}'\n") f.write("\n") "keyword">if instructions: f.write("INSTRUCTION-BASED PHRASES:\n") "keyword">for i, inst "keyword">in enumerate(instructions, 1): f.write(f" {i}. &#x27;{inst['original_phrase']}'\n") f.write("\n") f.write("NEXT STEPS:\n") f.write("- Review the identified phrases above\n") f.write("- Determine which phrase the professor wants anagrammed\n") f.write("- Create anagram(s) "keyword">from the selected phrase\n") print(f"\nDetailed analysis saved to: workspace/anagram_question_analysis.json") print(f"Summary report saved to: workspace/anagram_question_summary.txt") "keyword">except sr.UnknownValueError: print("\n*** TRANSCRIPTION FAILED ***") print("Google Speech Recognition could "keyword">not understand the audio") "keyword">except sr.RequestError "keyword">as e: print(f"\n*** SPEECH RECOGNITION SERVICE ERROR ***") print(f"Could "keyword">not request results "keyword">from Google Speech Recognition service: {e}") # Clean up temporary file "keyword">if os.path.exists(temp_wav): os.remove(temp_wav) print(f"\nTemporary file cleaned up: {temp_wav}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"\n*** ERROR PROCESSING AUDIO ***") print(f"Error: {str(e)}") "keyword">import traceback print(f"Full error details: {traceback.format_exc()}") print("\n*** ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ***")

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what files we have print("=== INSPECTING WORKSPACE FOR EXISTING ANALYSIS ===\n") # Check what files exist "keyword">in workspace workspace_dirs = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for item "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): item_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', item) "keyword">if os.path.isdir(item_path): workspace_dirs.append(item_path) print(f"Found workspace directory: {item_path}") # List files "keyword">in this directory "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(item_path): file_path = os.path.join(item_path, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size} bytes)") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found") # Look "keyword">for the analysis files mentioned "keyword">in the tester feedback analysis_files = [] "keyword">for workspace_dir "keyword">in workspace_dirs: "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): "keyword">if file.endswith(&#x27;.json') "keyword">or file.endswith('.txt'): analysis_files.append(os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)) print(f"\n=== FOUND {len(analysis_files)} ANALYSIS FILES ===\n") # Inspect the JSON analysis file first json_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in analysis_files "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;.json')] "keyword">if json_files: json_file = json_files[0] print(f"Inspecting JSON analysis file: {json_file}") # Load "keyword">and inspect the structure "keyword">with open(json_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) print(f"JSON file keys: {list(analysis_data.keys())}") # Display the structure safely "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in analysis_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, str): print(f" {key}: <string of length {len(value)}>") "keyword">if key == &#x27;transcription': print(f" Preview: {value[:100]}...") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: <list "keyword">with {len(value)} items>") "keyword">if value: print(f" First item type: {type(value[0])}") "keyword">if isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" First item keys: {list(value[0].keys())}") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: <dict "keyword">with keys: {list(value.keys())}>") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {value}") # Now let's examine the transcription "keyword">and extract the anagram phrase "keyword">if json_files: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING TRANSCRIPTION FOR ANAGRAM PHRASE ===\n") transcription = analysis_data.get(&#x27;transcription', '') print(f"Full transcription ({len(transcription)} chars):") print(f&#x27;"{transcription}"') print(f"\n=== EXTRACTING THE ANAGRAM PHRASE ===\n") # Based on the tester feedback, the anagram phrase "keyword">is: # ""keyword">in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" # Let's find this phrase "keyword">in the transcription # Look "keyword">for the part that starts "keyword">with "here's the anagram" anagram_start_phrase = "here&#x27;s the anagram" anagram_start_pos = transcription.lower().find(anagram_start_phrase) "keyword">if anagram_start_pos != -1: print(f"Found &#x27;here's the anagram' at position {anagram_start_pos}") # Extract everything after "here's the anagram" anagram_part = transcription[anagram_start_pos + len(anagram_start_phrase):].strip() print(f"Text after &#x27;here's the anagram': '{anagram_part}'") # The anagram phrase should be the rest of the sentence anagram_phrase = anagram_part "keyword">else: print("Could "keyword">not find &#x27;here's the anagram' "keyword">in transcription") # Let's "keyword">try to identify it manually by looking at the structure print("\nManual analysis of transcription structure:") # Split into sentences "keyword">or logical parts parts = transcription.split(&#x27;.') "keyword">for i, part "keyword">in enumerate(parts): part = part.strip() "keyword">if part: print(f"Part {i+1}: &#x27;{part}'") # Based on the tester feedback, let's extract the known anagram phrase anagram_phrase = ""keyword">in one of The Bard&#x27;s best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" print(f"\nBased on tester feedback, the anagram phrase "keyword">is:") print(f"&#x27;{anagram_phrase}'") print(f"\n=== ANAGRAM ANALYSIS ===\n") # Clean up the anagram phrase "keyword">if &#x27;anagram_phrase' "keyword">in locals(): # Remove any leading/trailing whitespace "keyword">and normalize clean_anagram = anagram_phrase.strip() print(f"Anagram to solve: &#x27;{clean_anagram}'") print(f"Length: {len(clean_anagram)} characters") # Count letters (ignoring spaces "keyword">and punctuation) letters_only = &#x27;'.join(c.lower() "keyword">for c "keyword">in clean_anagram "keyword">if c.isalpha()) print(f"Letters only: &#x27;{letters_only}'") print(f"Letter count: {len(letters_only)}") # Count each letter "keyword">from collections "keyword">import Counter letter_counts = Counter(letters_only) print(f"Letter frequency: {dict(sorted(letter_counts.items()))}") print(f"\n=== CONTEXT FROM TRANSCRIPTION ===\n") print("The professor says this anagram "keyword">is "keyword">from &#x27;one of The Bard's most well-known lines'") print("It&#x27;s "keyword">from 'one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies' - referring to Shakespeare's Hamlet") print("The student who provides the original line gets &#x27;an automatic a on next week's quiz'") # Save the extracted anagram information anagram_analysis = { &#x27;source_audio': analysis_data.get('source_file', 'unknown'), &#x27;full_transcription': transcription, &#x27;anagram_phrase': clean_anagram, &#x27;anagram_letters_only': letters_only, &#x27;letter_count': len(letters_only), &#x27;letter_frequency': dict(letter_counts), &#x27;context': { &#x27;source': 'Shakespeare (The Bard)', &#x27;work': 'Hamlet (one of his best thought of tragedies)', &#x27;description': 'one of his most well-known lines', &#x27;reward': 'automatic A on next week\'s quiz' }, &#x27;task': 'Find the original Shakespeare line that this anagram represents' } # Save the anagram analysis output_file = &#x27;workspace/anagram_phrase_extracted.json' "keyword">with open(output_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(anagram_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== RESULTS SAVED ===\n") print(f"Anagram analysis saved to: {output_file}") # Create a summary file summary_file = &#x27;workspace/anagram_challenge_summary.txt' "keyword">with open(summary_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write("PROFESSOR&#x27;S ANAGRAM CHALLENGE - EXTRACTED INFORMATION\n") f.write("=" * 60 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Source: {analysis_data.get(&#x27;source_file', 'Audio file')}\n\n") f.write("CHALLENGE DESCRIPTION:\n") f.write("- Find the original Shakespeare line that this anagram represents\n") f.write("- The line "keyword">is "keyword">from Hamlet (one of Shakespeare&#x27;s best-known tragedies)\n") f.write("- It&#x27;s described "keyword">as 'one of The Bard's most well-known lines'\n") f.write("- Reward: Automatic A on next week&#x27;s quiz\n\n") f.write("ANAGRAM TO SOLVE:\n") f.write(f"&#x27;{clean_anagram}'\n\n") f.write(f"LETTER ANALYSIS:\n") f.write(f"- Total characters: {len(clean_anagram)}\n") f.write(f"- Letters only: {len(letters_only)}\n") f.write(f"- Letters: {letters_only}\n") f.write(f"- Letter frequency: {dict(sorted(letter_counts.items()))}\n\n") f.write("FULL TRANSCRIPTION:\n") f.write("-" * 30 + "\n") f.write(transcription) f.write("\n" + "-" * 30 + "\n\n") f.write("NEXT STEP:\n") f.write("Rearrange the letters "keyword">in the anagram to find the famous Hamlet quote.\n") print(f"Challenge summary saved to: {summary_file}") print(f"\n=== EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Successfully extracted the anagram challenge:") print(f"ANAGRAM: &#x27;{clean_anagram}'") print(f"TASK: Find the original Shakespeare line "keyword">from Hamlet") print(f"CONTEXT: One of The Bard&#x27;s most well-known lines") "keyword">else: print("No JSON analysis file found to process") print("\n*** ANAGRAM PHRASE EXTRACTION COMPLETE ***")

2025-08-10 23:45:37

Next step: The transcription work was completed in previous iterations and saved to workspace files - check if the files are in a different workspace directory structure, or re-run the audio transcription to generate the required analysis files before attempting to extract the anagram phrase.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what files we have print("=== INSPECTING WORKSPACE FOR EXISTING ANALYSIS ===\n") # Check what files exist "keyword">in workspace workspace_dirs = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for item "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): item_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', item) "keyword">if os.path.isdir(item_path): workspace_dirs.append(item_path) print(f"Found workspace directory: {item_path}") # List files "keyword">in this directory "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(item_path): file_path = os.path.join(item_path, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size} bytes)") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found") # Look "keyword">for the analysis files mentioned "keyword">in the tester feedback analysis_files = [] "keyword">for workspace_dir "keyword">in workspace_dirs: "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): "keyword">if file.endswith(&#x27;.json') "keyword">or file.endswith('.txt'): analysis_files.append(os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)) print(f"\n=== FOUND {len(analysis_files)} ANALYSIS FILES ===\n") # Inspect the JSON analysis file first json_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in analysis_files "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;.json')] "keyword">if json_files: json_file = json_files[0] print(f"Inspecting JSON analysis file: {json_file}") # Load "keyword">and inspect the structure "keyword">with open(json_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) print(f"JSON file keys: {list(analysis_data.keys())}") # Display the structure safely "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in analysis_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, str): print(f" {key}: <string of length {len(value)}>") "keyword">if key == &#x27;transcription': print(f" Preview: {value[:100]}...") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: <list "keyword">with {len(value)} items>") "keyword">if value: print(f" First item type: {type(value[0])}") "keyword">if isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" First item keys: {list(value[0].keys())}") "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: <dict "keyword">with keys: {list(value.keys())}>") "keyword">else: print(f" {key}: {value}") # Now let's examine the transcription "keyword">and extract the anagram phrase "keyword">if json_files: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING TRANSCRIPTION FOR ANAGRAM PHRASE ===\n") transcription = analysis_data.get(&#x27;transcription', '') print(f"Full transcription ({len(transcription)} chars):") print(f&#x27;"{transcription}"') print(f"\n=== EXTRACTING THE ANAGRAM PHRASE ===\n") # Based on the tester feedback, the anagram phrase "keyword">is: # ""keyword">in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" # Let's find this phrase "keyword">in the transcription # Look "keyword">for the part that starts "keyword">with "here's the anagram" anagram_start_phrase = "here&#x27;s the anagram" anagram_start_pos = transcription.lower().find(anagram_start_phrase) "keyword">if anagram_start_pos != -1: print(f"Found &#x27;here's the anagram' at position {anagram_start_pos}") # Extract everything after "here's the anagram" anagram_part = transcription[anagram_start_pos + len(anagram_start_phrase):].strip() print(f"Text after &#x27;here's the anagram': '{anagram_part}'") # The anagram phrase should be the rest of the sentence anagram_phrase = anagram_part "keyword">else: print("Could "keyword">not find &#x27;here's the anagram' "keyword">in transcription") # Let's "keyword">try to identify it manually by looking at the structure print("\nManual analysis of transcription structure:") # Split into sentences "keyword">or logical parts parts = transcription.split(&#x27;.') "keyword">for i, part "keyword">in enumerate(parts): part = part.strip() "keyword">if part: print(f"Part {i+1}: &#x27;{part}'") # Based on the tester feedback, let's extract the known anagram phrase anagram_phrase = ""keyword">in one of The Bard&#x27;s best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" print(f"\nBased on tester feedback, the anagram phrase "keyword">is:") print(f"&#x27;{anagram_phrase}'") print(f"\n=== ANAGRAM ANALYSIS ===\n") # Clean up the anagram phrase "keyword">if &#x27;anagram_phrase' "keyword">in locals(): # Remove any leading/trailing whitespace "keyword">and normalize clean_anagram = anagram_phrase.strip() print(f"Anagram to solve: &#x27;{clean_anagram}'") print(f"Length: {len(clean_anagram)} characters") # Count letters (ignoring spaces "keyword">and punctuation) letters_only = &#x27;'.join(c.lower() "keyword">for c "keyword">in clean_anagram "keyword">if c.isalpha()) print(f"Letters only: &#x27;{letters_only}'") print(f"Letter count: {len(letters_only)}") # Count each letter "keyword">from collections "keyword">import Counter letter_counts = Counter(letters_only) print(f"Letter frequency: {dict(sorted(letter_counts.items()))}") print(f"\n=== CONTEXT FROM TRANSCRIPTION ===\n") print("The professor says this anagram "keyword">is "keyword">from &#x27;one of The Bard's most well-known lines'") print("It&#x27;s "keyword">from 'one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies' - referring to Shakespeare's Hamlet") print("The student who provides the original line gets &#x27;an automatic a on next week's quiz'") # Save the extracted anagram information anagram_analysis = { &#x27;source_audio': analysis_data.get('source_file', 'unknown'), &#x27;full_transcription': transcription, &#x27;anagram_phrase': clean_anagram, &#x27;anagram_letters_only': letters_only, &#x27;letter_count': len(letters_only), &#x27;letter_frequency': dict(letter_counts), &#x27;context': { &#x27;source': 'Shakespeare (The Bard)', &#x27;work': 'Hamlet (one of his best thought of tragedies)', &#x27;description': 'one of his most well-known lines', &#x27;reward': 'automatic A on next week\'s quiz' }, &#x27;task': 'Find the original Shakespeare line that this anagram represents' } # Save the anagram analysis output_file = &#x27;workspace/anagram_phrase_extracted.json' "keyword">with open(output_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(anagram_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== RESULTS SAVED ===\n") print(f"Anagram analysis saved to: {output_file}") # Create a summary file summary_file = &#x27;workspace/anagram_challenge_summary.txt' "keyword">with open(summary_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write("PROFESSOR&#x27;S ANAGRAM CHALLENGE - EXTRACTED INFORMATION\n") f.write("=" * 60 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Source: {analysis_data.get(&#x27;source_file', 'Audio file')}\n\n") f.write("CHALLENGE DESCRIPTION:\n") f.write("- Find the original Shakespeare line that this anagram represents\n") f.write("- The line "keyword">is "keyword">from Hamlet (one of Shakespeare&#x27;s best-known tragedies)\n") f.write("- It&#x27;s described "keyword">as 'one of The Bard's most well-known lines'\n") f.write("- Reward: Automatic A on next week&#x27;s quiz\n\n") f.write("ANAGRAM TO SOLVE:\n") f.write(f"&#x27;{clean_anagram}'\n\n") f.write(f"LETTER ANALYSIS:\n") f.write(f"- Total characters: {len(clean_anagram)}\n") f.write(f"- Letters only: {len(letters_only)}\n") f.write(f"- Letters: {letters_only}\n") f.write(f"- Letter frequency: {dict(sorted(letter_counts.items()))}\n\n") f.write("FULL TRANSCRIPTION:\n") f.write("-" * 30 + "\n") f.write(transcription) f.write("\n" + "-" * 30 + "\n\n") f.write("NEXT STEP:\n") f.write("Rearrange the letters "keyword">in the anagram to find the famous Hamlet quote.\n") print(f"Challenge summary saved to: {summary_file}") print(f"\n=== EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Successfully extracted the anagram challenge:") print(f"ANAGRAM: &#x27;{clean_anagram}'") print(f"TASK: Find the original Shakespeare line "keyword">from Hamlet") print(f"CONTEXT: One of The Bard&#x27;s most well-known lines") "keyword">else: print("No JSON analysis file found to process") print("\n*** ANAGRAM PHRASE EXTRACTION COMPLETE ***")
üìÑ Output

developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 4)
2025-08-10 23:46:55

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">from mutagen "keyword">import File "keyword">import speech_recognition "keyword">as sr "keyword">from pydub "keyword">import AudioSegment "keyword">import json "keyword">import re "keyword">from collections "keyword">import Counter # The path to the audio file to be parsed audio_path = "data/gaia/2023/validation/2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65.mp3" print("=== PROFESSOR&#x27;S ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS ===") print(f"Analyzing file: {audio_path}") # Check "keyword">if file exists "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(audio_path): print(f"Error: Audio file &#x27;{audio_path}' does "keyword">not exist.") # List available files "keyword">in the validation directory validation_dir = "data/gaia/2023/validation/" "keyword">if os.path.exists(validation_dir): print(f"Available files "keyword">in {validation_dir}:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(validation_dir): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.mp3', '.wav', '.m4a', '.aac')): print(f" - {file}") "keyword">else: print(f"File exists: {audio_path}") file_size = os.path.getsize(audio_path) print(f"File size: {file_size} bytes ({file_size / (1024 * 1024):.2f} MB)") supported_formats = [&#x27;.mp3', '.wav', '.m4a', '.aac', '.flac', '.ogg', '.wma'] file_ext = os.path.splitext(audio_path)[1].lower() print(f"File extension: {file_ext}") "keyword">if file_ext "keyword">not "keyword">in supported_formats: print(f"Error: Unsupported audio format &#x27;{file_ext}'. Supported formats: {', '.join(supported_formats)}") "keyword">else: print(f"Audio format "keyword">is supported: {file_ext}") # Extract metadata using mutagen print("\n=== EXTRACTING AUDIO METADATA ===") audiofile = File(audio_path) "keyword">if audiofile "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None: "keyword">if hasattr(audiofile, &#x27;mime') "keyword">and audiofile.mime: print(f"Format: {audiofile.mime[0]}") "keyword">if hasattr(audiofile.info, &#x27;length'): duration = audiofile.info.length print(f"Duration: {duration:.2f} seconds ({duration/60:.1f} minutes)") "keyword">if hasattr(audiofile.info, &#x27;bitrate'): print(f"Bitrate: {audiofile.info.bitrate} bps") "keyword">else: print("Could "keyword">not extract metadata "keyword">from audio file") # Extract transcription using speech recognition print("\n=== CONVERTING AUDIO TO TEXT USING SPEECH RECOGNITION ===") print("Loading audio file "keyword">with pydub...") "keyword">try: # Load the audio file audio = AudioSegment.from_file(audio_path) print(f"Audio loaded successfully: {len(audio)} ms duration") # Create temporary WAV file "keyword">for speech recognition temp_wav = "workspace/temp_anagram_audio.wav" print(f"Converting to WAV format "keyword">for speech recognition: {temp_wav}") # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs("workspace", exist_ok="keyword">True) # Export "keyword">as WAV "keyword">with optimal settings "keyword">for speech recognition audio.export(temp_wav, format="wav", parameters=["-ar", "16000", "-ac", "1"]) print(f"Audio converted to WAV: {os.path.getsize(temp_wav)} bytes") # Initialize speech recognizer recognizer = sr.Recognizer() print("Speech recognizer initialized") # Process the audio "keyword">for transcription print("Loading audio into speech recognizer...") "keyword">with sr.AudioFile(temp_wav) "keyword">as source: print("Adjusting "keyword">for ambient noise...") recognizer.adjust_for_ambient_noise(source, duration=0.5) print("Recording audio data...") audio_data = recognizer.record(source) print(f"Audio data recorded successfully") print("\n=== TRANSCRIBING AUDIO TO TEXT ===") print("Attempting transcription "keyword">with Google Speech Recognition...") # Transcribe audio to text using Google Speech Recognition "keyword">try: text = recognizer.recognize_google(audio_data, language=&#x27;en-US') print(f"\n*** TRANSCRIPTION SUCCESSFUL ***") print(f"Transcribed text length: {len(text)} characters") print("\n=== PROFESSOR&#x27;S ANAGRAM QUESTION CONTENT ===") print(f&#x27;Full transcription: "{text}"') # Based on the HISTORY feedback, extract the anagram phrase print("\n=== EXTRACTING THE ANAGRAM PHRASE ===") # The transcription "keyword">from HISTORY shows the anagram phrase comes after "here's the anagram" # From the feedback: ""keyword">in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" # Look "keyword">for the anagram phrase "keyword">in the transcription anagram_start_phrases = ["here&#x27;s the anagram", "here "keyword">is the anagram", "the anagram"] anagram_phrase = "keyword">None text_lower = text.lower() "keyword">for start_phrase "keyword">in anagram_start_phrases: start_pos = text_lower.find(start_phrase) "keyword">if start_pos != -1: print(f"Found &#x27;{start_phrase}' at position {start_pos}") # Extract everything after this phrase after_phrase = text[start_pos + len(start_phrase):].strip() print(f"Text after &#x27;{start_phrase}': '{after_phrase}'") anagram_phrase = after_phrase "keyword">break # If we couldn't find the start phrase, let's analyze the structure "keyword">if "keyword">not anagram_phrase: print("Could "keyword">not find anagram start phrase. Analyzing full transcription...") print("\nFull transcription analysis:") # Based on the HISTORY, the expected anagram phrase "keyword">is at the end # Let's look "keyword">for patterns that indicate the anagram "keyword">if ""keyword">in one of" "keyword">in text_lower "keyword">and "hamlet" "keyword">in text_lower: # Find the part starting "keyword">with ""keyword">in one of" in_one_pos = text_lower.find(""keyword">in one of") "keyword">if in_one_pos != -1: anagram_phrase = text[in_one_pos:].strip() print(f"Found anagram phrase starting "keyword">with &#x27;"keyword">in one of': '{anagram_phrase}'") # If still "keyword">not found, use the known phrase "keyword">from HISTORY feedback "keyword">if "keyword">not anagram_phrase: print("Using anagram phrase "keyword">from previous analysis...") anagram_phrase = ""keyword">in one of The Bard&#x27;s best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" print(f"Known anagram phrase: &#x27;{anagram_phrase}'") print(f"\n=== ANAGRAM ANALYSIS ===") print(f"Anagram to solve: &#x27;{anagram_phrase}'") print(f"Length: {len(anagram_phrase)} characters") # Clean the anagram phrase - remove punctuation "keyword">and extra spaces clean_anagram = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', anagram_phrase) clean_anagram = &#x27; '.join(clean_anagram.split()) # normalize spaces print(f"Cleaned anagram: &#x27;{clean_anagram}'") # Count letters (ignoring spaces) letters_only = &#x27;'.join(c.lower() "keyword">for c "keyword">in clean_anagram "keyword">if c.isalpha()) print(f"Letters only: &#x27;{letters_only}'") print(f"Letter count: {len(letters_only)}") # Count each letter frequency letter_counts = Counter(letters_only) print(f"Letter frequency: {dict(sorted(letter_counts.items()))}") print(f"\n=== CONTEXT FROM PROFESSOR ===") print("- This "keyword">is an anagram of &#x27;one of The Bard's most well-known lines'") print("- The original line "keyword">is "keyword">from Shakespeare (The Bard)") print("- It&#x27;s "keyword">from 'one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies' (Hamlet)") print("- Students who find the original line get &#x27;an automatic A on next week's quiz'") # Save comprehensive analysis anagram_analysis = { &#x27;source_audio': os.path.basename(audio_path), &#x27;full_transcription': text, &#x27;anagram_phrase_raw': anagram_phrase, &#x27;anagram_phrase_clean': clean_anagram, &#x27;letters_only': letters_only, &#x27;letter_count': len(letters_only), &#x27;letter_frequency': dict(sorted(letter_counts.items())), &#x27;context': { &#x27;source': 'Shakespeare (The Bard)', &#x27;work': 'Hamlet (one of his best thought of tragedies)', &#x27;description': 'one of his most well-known lines', &#x27;reward': 'automatic A on next week\'s quiz' }, &#x27;task': 'Rearrange the anagram letters to find the original Shakespeare line "keyword">from Hamlet', &#x27;analysis_timestamp': __import__('datetime').datetime.now().isoformat() } # Save the analysis analysis_file = &#x27;workspace/professor_anagram_analysis.json' "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(anagram_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== RESULTS SAVED ===") print(f"Complete analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Create a clear summary file summary_file = &#x27;workspace/anagram_challenge_summary.txt' "keyword">with open(summary_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write("PROFESSOR&#x27;S ANAGRAM CHALLENGE - COMPLETE ANALYSIS\n") f.write("=" * 55 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Source Audio: {os.path.basename(audio_path)}\n\n") f.write("CHALLENGE DESCRIPTION:\n") f.write("The professor presents an anagram challenge where students must:\n") f.write("- Rearrange the given anagram to find the original Shakespeare line\n") f.write("- The line "keyword">is "keyword">from Hamlet (one of Shakespeare&#x27;s best-known tragedies)\n") f.write("- It&#x27;s described "keyword">as 'one of The Bard's most well-known lines'\n") f.write("- Reward: Automatic A on next week&#x27;s quiz\n\n") f.write("ANAGRAM TO SOLVE:\n") f.write(f"Raw: &#x27;{anagram_phrase}'\n") f.write(f"Clean: &#x27;{clean_anagram}'\n\n") f.write(f"LETTER ANALYSIS:\n") f.write(f"- Total characters ("keyword">with spaces): {len(clean_anagram)}\n") f.write(f"- Letters only: {len(letters_only)}\n") f.write(f"- Letter sequence: {letters_only}\n") f.write(f"- Letter frequency: {dict(sorted(letter_counts.items()))}\n\n") f.write("FULL PROFESSOR&#x27;S TRANSCRIPTION:\n") f.write("-" * 40 + "\n") f.write(text) f.write("\n" + "-" * 40 + "\n\n") f.write("TASK SUMMARY:\n") f.write("Find the famous Hamlet quote by rearranging these letters:\n") f.write(f"{letters_only}\n") print(f"Challenge summary saved to: {summary_file}") print(f"\n=== EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===") print(f"Successfully extracted the professor&#x27;s anagram challenge:") print(f"\nANAGRAM: &#x27;{clean_anagram}'") print(f"LETTERS: {letters_only}") print(f"TASK: Find the original Shakespeare line "keyword">from Hamlet") print(f"CONTEXT: One of The Bard&#x27;s most well-known lines") print(f"REWARD: Automatic A on next week&#x27;s quiz") "keyword">except sr.UnknownValueError: print("\n*** TRANSCRIPTION FAILED ***") print("Google Speech Recognition could "keyword">not understand the audio") "keyword">except sr.RequestError "keyword">as e: print(f"\n*** SPEECH RECOGNITION SERVICE ERROR ***") print(f"Could "keyword">not request results "keyword">from Google Speech Recognition service: {e}") # Clean up temporary file "keyword">if os.path.exists(temp_wav): os.remove(temp_wav) print(f"\nTemporary file cleaned up: {temp_wav}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"\n*** ERROR PROCESSING AUDIO ***") print(f"Error: {str(e)}") "keyword">import traceback print(f"Full error details: {traceback.format_exc()}") print("\n*** ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ***")

Code Output: === PROFESSOR'S ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS === Analyzing file: data/gaia/2023/validation/2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65.mp3 File exists: data/gaia/2023/validation/2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65.mp3 File size: 205008 bytes (0.20 MB) File extension: .mp3 Audio format is supported: .mp3 === EXTRACTING AUDIO METADATA === Format: audio/mp3 Duration: 25.63 seconds (0.4 minutes) Bitrate: 64000 bps === CONVERTING AUDIO TO TEXT USING SPEECH RECOGNITION === Loading audio file with pydub... Audio loaded successfully: 25626 ms duration Converting to WAV format for speech recognition: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/temp_anagram_audio.wav Audio converted to WAV: 820114 bytes Speech recognizer initialized Loading audio into speech recognizer... Adjusting for ambient noise... Recording audio data... Audio data recorded successfully === TRANSCRIBING AUDIO TO TEXT === Attempting transcription with Google Speech Recognition... *** TRANSCRIPTION SUCCESSFUL *** Transcribed text length: 331 characters === PROFESSOR'S ANAGRAM QUESTION CONTENT === Full transcription: "is actually an anagram of one of The Bard's most well-known lines I'd like you all to think about it and anyone who can provide the original line will get an automatic a on next week's quiz here's the anagram in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" === EXTRACTING THE ANAGRAM PHRASE === Found 'here's the anagram' at position 190 Text after 'here's the anagram': 'in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten' === ANAGRAM ANALYSIS === Anagram to solve: 'in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten' Length: 122 characters Cleaned anagram: 'in one of The Bards best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten' Letters only: 'inoneofthebardsbestthoughtoftragediesareinsistentherohamletqueriesontwofrontsabouthowlifeturnsrotten' Letter count: 100 Letter frequency: {'a': 5, 'b': 3, 'd': 2, 'e': 13, 'f': 4, 'g': 2, 'h': 6, 'i': 6, 'l': 2, 'm': 1, 'n': 8, 'o': 11, 'q': 1, 'r': 8, 's': 8, 't': 14, 'u': 4, 'w': 2} === CONTEXT FROM PROFESSOR === - This is an anagram of 'one of The Bard's most well-known lines' - The original line is from Shakespeare (The Bard) - It's from 'one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies' (Hamlet) - Students who find the original line get 'an automatic A on next week's quiz' === RESULTS SAVED === Complete analysis saved to: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/professor_anagram_analysis.json Challenge summary saved to: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/anagram_challenge_summary.txt === EXTRACTION COMPLETE === Successfully extracted the professor's anagram challenge: ANAGRAM: 'in one of The Bards best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten' LETTERS: inoneofthebardsbestthoughtoftragediesareinsistentherohamletqueriesontwofrontsabouthowlifeturnsrotten TASK: Find the original Shakespeare line from Hamlet CONTEXT: One of The Bard's most well-known lines REWARD: Automatic A on next week's quiz Temporary file cleaned up: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/temp_anagram_audio.wav *** ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ***
tester Code Testing
2025-08-10 23:46:55

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completely fulfilled the **PLAN** requirements. The audio file was successfully transcribed, revealing the professor's anagram challenge: 'in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten'. The code extracted all key information: (1) The anagram phrase to be rearranged, (2) The context that it's from Shakespeare's Hamlet (one of his most well-known lines), (3) The professor's criteria (find the original line to get an automatic A on the quiz), (4) Complete letter analysis with frequency counts. Comprehensive analysis files were saved to workspace including JSON data and summary text files. **PLAN** alignment: 100% - successfully analyzed the audio file and extracted both the professor's anagram question and the specific request/criteria. The anagram challenge is now fully understood: rearrange the 100 letters to find the famous Hamlet quote. No further development needed for the audio analysis portion.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">from mutagen "keyword">import File "keyword">import speech_recognition "keyword">as sr "keyword">from pydub "keyword">import AudioSegment "keyword">import json "keyword">import re "keyword">from collections "keyword">import Counter # The path to the audio file to be parsed audio_path = "data/gaia/2023/validation/2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65.mp3" print("=== PROFESSOR&#x27;S ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS ===") print(f"Analyzing file: {audio_path}") # Check "keyword">if file exists "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(audio_path): print(f"Error: Audio file &#x27;{audio_path}' does "keyword">not exist.") # List available files "keyword">in the validation directory validation_dir = "data/gaia/2023/validation/" "keyword">if os.path.exists(validation_dir): print(f"Available files "keyword">in {validation_dir}:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(validation_dir): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.mp3', '.wav', '.m4a', '.aac')): print(f" - {file}") "keyword">else: print(f"File exists: {audio_path}") file_size = os.path.getsize(audio_path) print(f"File size: {file_size} bytes ({file_size / (1024 * 1024):.2f} MB)") supported_formats = [&#x27;.mp3', '.wav', '.m4a', '.aac', '.flac', '.ogg', '.wma'] file_ext = os.path.splitext(audio_path)[1].lower() print(f"File extension: {file_ext}") "keyword">if file_ext "keyword">not "keyword">in supported_formats: print(f"Error: Unsupported audio format &#x27;{file_ext}'. Supported formats: {', '.join(supported_formats)}") "keyword">else: print(f"Audio format "keyword">is supported: {file_ext}") # Extract metadata using mutagen print("\n=== EXTRACTING AUDIO METADATA ===") audiofile = File(audio_path) "keyword">if audiofile "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None: "keyword">if hasattr(audiofile, &#x27;mime') "keyword">and audiofile.mime: print(f"Format: {audiofile.mime[0]}") "keyword">if hasattr(audiofile.info, &#x27;length'): duration = audiofile.info.length print(f"Duration: {duration:.2f} seconds ({duration/60:.1f} minutes)") "keyword">if hasattr(audiofile.info, &#x27;bitrate'): print(f"Bitrate: {audiofile.info.bitrate} bps") "keyword">else: print("Could "keyword">not extract metadata "keyword">from audio file") # Extract transcription using speech recognition print("\n=== CONVERTING AUDIO TO TEXT USING SPEECH RECOGNITION ===") print("Loading audio file "keyword">with pydub...") "keyword">try: # Load the audio file audio = AudioSegment.from_file(audio_path) print(f"Audio loaded successfully: {len(audio)} ms duration") # Create temporary WAV file "keyword">for speech recognition temp_wav = "workspace/temp_anagram_audio.wav" print(f"Converting to WAV format "keyword">for speech recognition: {temp_wav}") # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs("workspace", exist_ok="keyword">True) # Export "keyword">as WAV "keyword">with optimal settings "keyword">for speech recognition audio.export(temp_wav, format="wav", parameters=["-ar", "16000", "-ac", "1"]) print(f"Audio converted to WAV: {os.path.getsize(temp_wav)} bytes") # Initialize speech recognizer recognizer = sr.Recognizer() print("Speech recognizer initialized") # Process the audio "keyword">for transcription print("Loading audio into speech recognizer...") "keyword">with sr.AudioFile(temp_wav) "keyword">as source: print("Adjusting "keyword">for ambient noise...") recognizer.adjust_for_ambient_noise(source, duration=0.5) print("Recording audio data...") audio_data = recognizer.record(source) print(f"Audio data recorded successfully") print("\n=== TRANSCRIBING AUDIO TO TEXT ===") print("Attempting transcription "keyword">with Google Speech Recognition...") # Transcribe audio to text using Google Speech Recognition "keyword">try: text = recognizer.recognize_google(audio_data, language=&#x27;en-US') print(f"\n*** TRANSCRIPTION SUCCESSFUL ***") print(f"Transcribed text length: {len(text)} characters") print("\n=== PROFESSOR&#x27;S ANAGRAM QUESTION CONTENT ===") print(f&#x27;Full transcription: "{text}"') # Based on the HISTORY feedback, extract the anagram phrase print("\n=== EXTRACTING THE ANAGRAM PHRASE ===") # The transcription "keyword">from HISTORY shows the anagram phrase comes after "here's the anagram" # From the feedback: ""keyword">in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" # Look "keyword">for the anagram phrase "keyword">in the transcription anagram_start_phrases = ["here&#x27;s the anagram", "here "keyword">is the anagram", "the anagram"] anagram_phrase = "keyword">None text_lower = text.lower() "keyword">for start_phrase "keyword">in anagram_start_phrases: start_pos = text_lower.find(start_phrase) "keyword">if start_pos != -1: print(f"Found &#x27;{start_phrase}' at position {start_pos}") # Extract everything after this phrase after_phrase = text[start_pos + len(start_phrase):].strip() print(f"Text after &#x27;{start_phrase}': '{after_phrase}'") anagram_phrase = after_phrase "keyword">break # If we couldn't find the start phrase, let's analyze the structure "keyword">if "keyword">not anagram_phrase: print("Could "keyword">not find anagram start phrase. Analyzing full transcription...") print("\nFull transcription analysis:") # Based on the HISTORY, the expected anagram phrase "keyword">is at the end # Let's look "keyword">for patterns that indicate the anagram "keyword">if ""keyword">in one of" "keyword">in text_lower "keyword">and "hamlet" "keyword">in text_lower: # Find the part starting "keyword">with ""keyword">in one of" in_one_pos = text_lower.find(""keyword">in one of") "keyword">if in_one_pos != -1: anagram_phrase = text[in_one_pos:].strip() print(f"Found anagram phrase starting "keyword">with &#x27;"keyword">in one of': '{anagram_phrase}'") # If still "keyword">not found, use the known phrase "keyword">from HISTORY feedback "keyword">if "keyword">not anagram_phrase: print("Using anagram phrase "keyword">from previous analysis...") anagram_phrase = ""keyword">in one of The Bard&#x27;s best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" print(f"Known anagram phrase: &#x27;{anagram_phrase}'") print(f"\n=== ANAGRAM ANALYSIS ===") print(f"Anagram to solve: &#x27;{anagram_phrase}'") print(f"Length: {len(anagram_phrase)} characters") # Clean the anagram phrase - remove punctuation "keyword">and extra spaces clean_anagram = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', anagram_phrase) clean_anagram = &#x27; '.join(clean_anagram.split()) # normalize spaces print(f"Cleaned anagram: &#x27;{clean_anagram}'") # Count letters (ignoring spaces) letters_only = &#x27;'.join(c.lower() "keyword">for c "keyword">in clean_anagram "keyword">if c.isalpha()) print(f"Letters only: &#x27;{letters_only}'") print(f"Letter count: {len(letters_only)}") # Count each letter frequency letter_counts = Counter(letters_only) print(f"Letter frequency: {dict(sorted(letter_counts.items()))}") print(f"\n=== CONTEXT FROM PROFESSOR ===") print("- This "keyword">is an anagram of &#x27;one of The Bard's most well-known lines'") print("- The original line "keyword">is "keyword">from Shakespeare (The Bard)") print("- It&#x27;s "keyword">from 'one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies' (Hamlet)") print("- Students who find the original line get &#x27;an automatic A on next week's quiz'") # Save comprehensive analysis anagram_analysis = { &#x27;source_audio': os.path.basename(audio_path), &#x27;full_transcription': text, &#x27;anagram_phrase_raw': anagram_phrase, &#x27;anagram_phrase_clean': clean_anagram, &#x27;letters_only': letters_only, &#x27;letter_count': len(letters_only), &#x27;letter_frequency': dict(sorted(letter_counts.items())), &#x27;context': { &#x27;source': 'Shakespeare (The Bard)', &#x27;work': 'Hamlet (one of his best thought of tragedies)', &#x27;description': 'one of his most well-known lines', &#x27;reward': 'automatic A on next week\'s quiz' }, &#x27;task': 'Rearrange the anagram letters to find the original Shakespeare line "keyword">from Hamlet', &#x27;analysis_timestamp': __import__('datetime').datetime.now().isoformat() } # Save the analysis analysis_file = &#x27;workspace/professor_anagram_analysis.json' "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(anagram_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== RESULTS SAVED ===") print(f"Complete analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Create a clear summary file summary_file = &#x27;workspace/anagram_challenge_summary.txt' "keyword">with open(summary_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write("PROFESSOR&#x27;S ANAGRAM CHALLENGE - COMPLETE ANALYSIS\n") f.write("=" * 55 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Source Audio: {os.path.basename(audio_path)}\n\n") f.write("CHALLENGE DESCRIPTION:\n") f.write("The professor presents an anagram challenge where students must:\n") f.write("- Rearrange the given anagram to find the original Shakespeare line\n") f.write("- The line "keyword">is "keyword">from Hamlet (one of Shakespeare&#x27;s best-known tragedies)\n") f.write("- It&#x27;s described "keyword">as 'one of The Bard's most well-known lines'\n") f.write("- Reward: Automatic A on next week&#x27;s quiz\n\n") f.write("ANAGRAM TO SOLVE:\n") f.write(f"Raw: &#x27;{anagram_phrase}'\n") f.write(f"Clean: &#x27;{clean_anagram}'\n\n") f.write(f"LETTER ANALYSIS:\n") f.write(f"- Total characters ("keyword">with spaces): {len(clean_anagram)}\n") f.write(f"- Letters only: {len(letters_only)}\n") f.write(f"- Letter sequence: {letters_only}\n") f.write(f"- Letter frequency: {dict(sorted(letter_counts.items()))}\n\n") f.write("FULL PROFESSOR&#x27;S TRANSCRIPTION:\n") f.write("-" * 40 + "\n") f.write(text) f.write("\n" + "-" * 40 + "\n\n") f.write("TASK SUMMARY:\n") f.write("Find the famous Hamlet quote by rearranging these letters:\n") f.write(f"{letters_only}\n") print(f"Challenge summary saved to: {summary_file}") print(f"\n=== EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===") print(f"Successfully extracted the professor&#x27;s anagram challenge:") print(f"\nANAGRAM: &#x27;{clean_anagram}'") print(f"LETTERS: {letters_only}") print(f"TASK: Find the original Shakespeare line "keyword">from Hamlet") print(f"CONTEXT: One of The Bard&#x27;s most well-known lines") print(f"REWARD: Automatic A on next week&#x27;s quiz") "keyword">except sr.UnknownValueError: print("\n*** TRANSCRIPTION FAILED ***") print("Google Speech Recognition could "keyword">not understand the audio") "keyword">except sr.RequestError "keyword">as e: print(f"\n*** SPEECH RECOGNITION SERVICE ERROR ***") print(f"Could "keyword">not request results "keyword">from Google Speech Recognition service: {e}") # Clean up temporary file "keyword">if os.path.exists(temp_wav): os.remove(temp_wav) print(f"\nTemporary file cleaned up: {temp_wav}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"\n*** ERROR PROCESSING AUDIO ***") print(f"Error: {str(e)}") "keyword">import traceback print(f"Full error details: {traceback.format_exc()}") print("\n*** ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ***")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === PROFESSOR'S ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS === Analyzing file: data/gaia/2023/validation/2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65.mp3 File exists: data/gaia/2023/validation/2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65.mp3 File size: 205008 bytes (0.20 MB) File extension: .mp3 Audio format is supported: .mp3 === EXTRACTING AUDIO METADATA === Format: audio/mp3 Duration: 25.63 seconds (0.4 minutes) Bitrate: 64000 bps === CONVERTING AUDIO TO TEXT USING SPEECH RECOGNITION === Loading audio file with pydub... Audio loaded successfully: 25626 ms duration Converting to WAV format for speech recognition: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/temp_anagram_audio.wav Audio converted to WAV: 820114 bytes Speech recognizer initialized Loading audio into speech recognizer... Adjusting for ambient noise... Recording audio data... Audio data recorded successfully === TRANSCRIBING AUDIO TO TEXT === Attempting transcription with Google Speech Recognition... *** TRANSCRIPTION SUCCESSFUL *** Transcribed text length: 331 characters === PROFESSOR'S ANAGRAM QUESTION CONTENT === Full transcription: "is actually an anagram of one of The Bard's most well-known lines I'd like you all to think about it and anyone who can provide the original line will get an automatic a on next week's quiz here's the anagram in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" === EXTRACTING THE ANAGRAM PHRASE === Found 'here's the anagram' at position 190 Text after 'here's the anagram': 'in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten' === ANAGRAM ANALYSIS === Anagram to solve: 'in one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten' Length: 122 characters Cleaned anagram: 'in one of The Bards best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten' Letters only: 'inoneofthebardsbestthoughtoftragediesareinsistentherohamletqueriesontwofrontsabouthowlifeturnsrotten' Letter count: 100 Letter frequency: {'a': 5, 'b': 3, 'd': 2, 'e': 13, 'f': 4, 'g': 2, 'h': 6, 'i': 6, 'l': 2, 'm': 1, 'n': 8, 'o': 11, 'q': 1, 'r': 8, 's': 8, 't': 14, 'u': 4, 'w': 2} === CONTEXT FROM PROFESSOR === - This is an anagram of 'one of The Bard's most well-known lines' - The original line is from Shakespeare (The Bard) - It's from 'one of The Bard's best thought of tragedies' (Hamlet) - Students who find the original line get 'an automatic A on next week's quiz' === RESULTS SAVED === Complete analysis saved to: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/professor_anagram_analysis.json Challenge summary saved to: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/anagram_challenge_summary.txt === EXTRACTION COMPLETE === Successfully extracted the professor's anagram challenge: ANAGRAM: 'in one of The Bards best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten' LETTERS: inoneofthebardsbestthoughtoftragediesareinsistentherohamletqueriesontwofrontsabouthowlifeturnsrotten TASK: Find the original Shakespeare line from Hamlet CONTEXT: One of The Bard's most well-known lines REWARD: Automatic A on next week's quiz Temporary file cleaned up: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/temp_anagram_audio.wav *** ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ***
developer Developer History - Plan 01
2025-08-10 23:47:06

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nfrom mutagen import File\nimport speech_recognition as sr\nfrom pydub import AudioSegment\nimport json\n\n# The path to the audio file to be parsed\naudio_path = "data/gaia/2023/validation/2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65.mp3"\n\nprint("=== AUDIO FILE ANALYSIS FOR PROFESSOR\'S ANAGRAM QUESTION ===")\nprint(f"Analyzing file: {audio_path}")\n\n# Check if file exists\nif not os.path.exists(audio_path):\n print(f"Error: Audio file \'{audio_path}\' does not exist.")\n # List available files in the validation directory\n validation_dir = "data/gaia/2023/validation/"\n if os.path.exists(validation_dir):\n print(f"Available files in {validation_dir}:")\n for file in os.listdir(validation_dir):\n if file.endswith((\'.mp3\', \'.wav\', \'.m4a\', \'.aac\')):\n print(f" - {file}")\nelse:\n print(f"File exists: {audio_path}")\n file_size = os.path.getsize(audio_path)\n print(f"File size: {file_size} bytes ({file_size / (1024 * 1024):.2f} MB)")\n\n supported_formats = [\'.mp3\', \'.wav\', \'.m4a\', \'.aac\', \'.flac\', \'.ogg\', \'.wma\']\n file_ext = os.path.splitext(audio_path)[1].lower()\n print(f"File extension: {file_ext}")\n\n if file_ext not in supported_formats:\n print(f"Error: Unsupported audio format \'{file_ext}\'. Supported formats: {\', \'.join(supported_formats)}")\n else:\n print(f"Audio format is supported: {file_ext}")\n\n # Extract metadata using mutagen\n print("\\n=== EXTRACTING AUDIO METADATA ===")\n audiofile = File(audio_path)\n if audiofile is not None:\n if hasattr(audiofile, \'mime\') and audiofile.mime:\n print(f"Format: {audiofile.mime[0]}")\n \n if hasattr(audiofile.info, \'length\'):\n duration = audiofile.info.length\n print(f"Duration: {duration:.2f} seconds ({duration/60:.1f} minutes)")\n \n if hasattr(audiofile.info, \'bitrate\'):\n print(f"Bitrate: {audiofile.info.bitrate} bps")\n \n # Extract common tags like title, artist, album, date, genre\n tags = [\'title\', \'artist\', \'album\', \'date\', \'genre\']\n for tag in tags:\n if tag in audiofile and audiofile[tag]:\n print(f"{tag.capitalize()}: {audiofile[tag][0]}")\n else:\n print("Could not extract metadata from audio file")\n\n # Extract transcription using speech recognition\n print("\\n=== CONVERTING AUDIO TO TEXT USING SPEECH RECOGNITION ===")\n print("Loading audio file with pydub...")\n \n try:\n # Load the audio file\n audio = AudioSegment.from_file(audio_path)\n print(f"Audio loaded successfully: {len(audio)} ms duration")\n \n # Create temporary WAV file for speech recognition\n temp_wav = "workspace/temp_anagram_audio.wav"\n print(f"Converting to WAV format for speech recognition: {temp_wav}")\n \n # Ensure workspace directory exists\n os.makedirs("workspace", exist_ok=True)\n \n # Export as WAV with optimal settings for speech recognition\n audio.export(temp_wav, format="wav", parameters=["-ar", "16000", "-ac", "1"])\n print(f"Audio converted to WAV: {os.path.getsize(temp_wav)} bytes")\n\n # Initialize speech recognizer\n recognizer = sr.Recognizer()\n print("Speech recognizer initialized")\n\n # Process the audio for transcription\n print("Loading audio into speech recognizer...")\n with sr.AudioFile(temp_wav) as source:\n print("Adjusting for ambient noise...")\n recognizer.adjust_for_ambient_noise(source, duration=0.5)\n \n print("Recording audio data...")\n audio_data = recognizer.record(source)\n print(f"Audio data recorded successfully")\n \n print("\\n=== TRANSCRIBING AUDIO TO TEXT ===")\n print("Attempting transcription with Google Speech Recognition...")\n \n # Transcribe audio to text using Google Speech Recognition\n try:\n text = recognizer.recognize_google(audio_data, language=\'en-US\')\n \n print(f"\\n*** TRANSCRIPTION SUCCESSFUL ***")\n print(f"Transcribed text length: {len(text)} characters")\n \n print("\\n=== PROFESSOR\'S ANAGRAM QUESTION CONTENT ===")\n print(text)\n \n # Save the transcription to workspace\n with open(\'workspace/professor_anagram_transcription.txt\', \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write("PROFESSOR\'S ANAGRAM QUESTION TRANSCRIPTION\\n")\n f.write("=" * 50 + "\\n\\n")\n f.write(f"Source: {os.path.basename(audio_path)}\\n")\n f.write(f"Transcribed on: {__import__(\'datetime\').datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\')}\\n\\n")\n f.write("TRANSCRIBED CONTENT:\\n")\n f.write("-" * 30 + "\\n")\n f.write(text)\n f.write("\\n" + "-" * 30)\n \n print(f"\\nTranscription saved to: workspace/professor_anagram_transcription.txt")\n \n # Now analyze the text for anagram-related content\n print("\\n=== ANALYZING TEXT FOR ANAGRAM QUESTION ===")\n print("Searching for anagram instructions and original phrase...")\n \n import re\n \n # Look for key anagram-related phrases\n anagram_keywords = [\n \'anagram\', \'rearrange\', \'letters\', \'scramble\', \'unscramble\',\n \'reorder\', \'permutation\', \'mix up\', \'jumble\', \'word puzzle\'\n ]\n \n text_lower = text.lower()\n found_keywords = []\n \n for keyword in anagram_keywords:\n if keyword in text_lower:\n found_keywords.append(keyword)\n # Find context around the keyword\n start_pos = text_lower.find(keyword)\n context_start = max(0, start_pos - 50)\n context_end = min(len(text), start_pos + len(keyword) + 50)\n context = text[context_start:context_end]\n print(f"Found \'{keyword}\' in context: ...{context}...")\n \n print(f"\\nAnagram-related keywords found: {found_keywords}")\n \n # Look for quoted phrases or specific instructions\n print("\\n=== SEARCHING FOR QUOTED PHRASES OR SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS ===")\n \n # Look for quoted text (potential original phrase to anagram)\n quote_patterns = [\n r\'"([^"]+)"\', # Double quotes\n r"\'([^\']+)\'", # Single quotes\n r\'phrase\\s+["\']([^"\']+)["\']\', # "phrase \'text\'"\n r\'line\\s+["\']([^"\']+)["\']\', # "line \'text\'"\n r\'words?\\s+["\']([^"\']+)["\']\', # "word \'text\'"\n ]\n \n quoted_phrases = []\n for pattern in quote_patterns:\n matches = re.finditer(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE)\n for match in matches:\n phrase = match.group(1)\n # Get context\n start_context = max(0, match.start() - 40)\n end_context = min(len(text), match.end() + 40)\n context = text[start_context:end_context]\n \n quoted_phrases.append({\n \'phrase\': phrase,\n \'context\': context,\n \'pattern\': pattern\n })\n print(f"Found quoted phrase: \'{phrase}\'")\n print(f" Context: ...{context}...")\n \n # Look for instruction patterns\n print("\\n=== SEARCHING FOR INSTRUCTION PATTERNS ===")\n \n instruction_patterns = [\n r\'make an anagram of (.+?)(?:\\.|$)\',\n r\'create an anagram from (.+?)(?:\\.|$)\',\n r\'rearrange the letters? of (.+?)(?:\\.|$)\',\n r\'scramble the word[s]? (.+?)(?:\\.|$)\',\n r\'form an anagram using (.+?)(?:\\.|$)\',\n r\'anagram the phrase (.+?)(?:\\.|$)\',\n r\'take the (?:phrase|line|words?) (.+?) and\',\n r\'using the letters? (?:from|in|of) (.+?)(?:,|\\.|$)\'\n ]\n \n instructions = []\n for pattern in instruction_patterns:\n matches = re.finditer(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE)\n for match in matches:\n instruction_text = match.group(1).strip()\n # Clean up common endings\n instruction_text = re.sub(r\'[,\\.]$\', \'\', instruction_text)\n \n # Get context\n start_context = max(0, match.start() - 30)\n end_context = min(len(text), match.end() + 30)\n context = text[start_context:end_context]\n \n instructions.append({\n \'original_phrase\': instruction_text,\n \'context\': context,\n \'pattern\': pattern\n })\n print(f"Found instruction: \'{instruction_text}\'")\n print(f" Context: ...{context}...")\n \n # Compile results\n results = {\n \'source_file\': os.path.basename(audio_path),\n \'transcription\': text,\n \'anagram_keywords_found\': found_keywords,\n \'quoted_phrases\': quoted_phrases,\n \'instructions\': instructions,\n \'analysis_timestamp\': __import__(\'datetime\').datetime.now().isoformat()\n }\n \n # Save detailed analysis\n with open(\'workspace/anagram_question_analysis.json\', \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(results, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\n=== ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===")\n print(f"Anagram keywords found: {len(found_keywords)}")\n print(f"Quoted phrases found: {len(quoted_phrases)}")\n print(f"Instruction patterns found: {len(instructions)}")\n \n if quoted_phrases:\n print(f"\\nMost likely original phrase(s) to anagram:")\n for i, phrase_info in enumerate(quoted_phrases, 1):\n print(f" {i}. \'{phrase_info[\'phrase\']}\'")\n \n if instructions:\n print(f"\\nInstruction-based phrases to anagram:")\n for i, inst in enumerate(instructions, 1):\n print(f" {i}. \'{inst[\'original_phrase\']}\'")\n \n # Create summary report\n with open(\'workspace/anagram_question_summary.txt\', \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write("PROFESSOR\'S ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS SUMMARY\\n")\n f.write("=" * 55 + "\\n\\n")\n f.write(f"Source Audio: {os.path.basename(audio_path)}\\n\\n")\n \n f.write("FULL TRANSCRIPTION:\\n")\n f.write("-" * 20 + "\\n")\n f.write(text + "\\n")\n f.write("-" * 20 + "\\n\\n")\n \n if found_keywords:\n f.write(f"ANAGRAM KEYWORDS DETECTED: {\', \'.join(found_keywords)}\\n\\n")\n \n if quoted_phrases:\n f.write("QUOTED PHRASES (Potential Original Text):\\n")\n for i, phrase_info in enumerate(quoted_phrases, 1):\n f.write(f" {i}. \'{phrase_info[\'phrase\']}\'\\n")\n f.write("\\n")\n \n if instructions:\n f.write("INSTRUCTION-BASED PHRASES:\\n")\n for i, inst in enumerate(instructions, 1):\n f.write(f" {i}. \'{inst[\'original_phrase\']}\'\\n")\n f.write("\\n")\n \n f.write("NEXT STEPS:\\n")\n f.write("- Review the identified phrases above\\n")\n f.write("- Determine which phrase the professor wants anagrammed\\n")\n f.write("- Create anagram(s) from the selected phrase\\n")\n \n print(f"\\nDetailed analysis saved to: workspace/anagram_question_analysis.json")\n print(f"Summary report saved to: workspace/anagram_question_summary.txt")\n \n except sr.UnknownValueError:\n print("\\n*** TRANSCRIPTION FAILED ***")\n print("Google Speech Recognition could not understand the audio")\n \n except sr.RequestError as e:\n print(f"\\n*** SPEECH RECOGNITION SERVICE ERROR ***")\n print(f"Could not request results from Google Speech Recognition service: {e}")\n\n # Clean up temporary file\n if os.path.exists(temp_wav):\n os.remove(temp_wav)\n print(f"\\nTemporary file cleaned up: {temp_wav}")\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f"\\n*** ERROR PROCESSING AUDIO ***")\n print(f"Error: {str(e)}")\n import traceback\n print(f"Full error details: {traceback.format_exc()}")\n\nprint("\\n*** ANAGRAM QUESTION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ***")',
"description": "This implementation analyzes the professor's audio file to extract the anagram question. The approach includes: (1) Loading and validating the audio file with metadata extraction, (2) Converting audio to text using Google Speech Recognition with proper preprocessing, (3) Systematically searching for anagram-related keywords and instruction patterns, (4) Identifying quoted phrases that likely contain the original text to be anagrammed, (5) Using regex patterns to extract specific instructions about what needs to be rearranged. The code saves comprehensive analysis results to workspace files including the full transcription, identified phrases, and a summary report. This will help identify both the original phrase/line that needs to be rearranged and the specific criteria or request the professor mentioned for creating the anagram.",
}

"role": 'tester',
"feedback": 'Execution failed - SyntaxError at line 153 due to invalid regex pattern syntax. The code attempted to analyze an audio file for anagram questions but crashed before any processing could begin. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no audio analysis completed due to syntax error. Recommended fix: Properly escape the quotes in the regex patterns, specifically change `[^"\']+` to `[^"\']+` or use different quote delimiters to avoid conflicts with the raw string syntax.',
